careers.title: Software Engineer
careers.education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
steps: Learn at least one programming language (e.g., Python, JavaScript)
Build small projects to showcase skills
Participate in coding bootcamps or online courses
Get an internship or entry-level position
Contribute to open-source projects
Pursue certifications like AWS Certified Developer
Apply for full-time positions

careers.title: Data Scientist
careers.education: Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, or related field
steps: Acquire strong foundations in statistics and mathematics
Learn programming languages like Python or R
Master data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Gain experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow)
Work on personal or Kaggle data projects
Seek internships or jobs in data analysis
Consider advanced degrees or specialized training
Network at data science conferences or meetups

careers.title: Project Manager
careers.education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, or related field
steps: Develop skills in leadership, communication, and organization
Understand project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum)
Gain certification like PMP (Project Management Professional)
Start in a coordinator or assistant PM role
Manage small projects to build experience
Learn to use project management software
Advance to managing larger or more complex projects
Continue professional development through courses or workshops

careers.title: Graphic Designer
careers.education: Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design or Fine Arts
steps: Build a strong portfolio showcasing diverse work
Master design software (Adobe Creative Suite)
Understand branding, typography, and color theory
Freelance or intern to gain practical experience
Participate in design competitions or hackathons
Network with other designers and potential clients
Stay updated with design trends
Consider specialization in areas like UI/UX design
